<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/14/zillow-report-finds-suburban-housing-markets-not-growing-expense-cities?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew Mythbusters: Real Estate Edition
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Simpsons clip showing moving houses" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=511 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3orifebk0oO42ZWN20/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Simpsons clip showing moving houses" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3orifebk0oO42ZWN20/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of the enduring narratives of the pandemic is that Americans are ditching cities and embracing the suburbs. But a <a href="https://www.zillow.com/research/2020-urb-suburb-market-report-27712/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new study</a> from Zillow claims we might be driving up the wrong cul de sac. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The real estate company found that generally speaking, suburban housing markets have <em>not</em> strengthened relative to urban markets during the pandemic. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Both region types appear to be hot sellers’ markets right now—while many suburban areas have seen strong improvement in housing activity in recent months, so, too, have many urban areas,” Zillow says. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While for-sale suburban homes attract more than 3x the traffic on Zillow right now than urban listings, that’s no different than last year.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The outliers</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New York City and San Francisco. These hubs of innovation and $14 Bud Lights may actually be facing a significant housing downturn.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Per </span><span><a href="https://streeteasy.com/blog/july-2020-market-reports/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">StreetEasy</a></span><span>, Manhattan home values dropped 4.2% since last year and homes are staying on the market over two months longer.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>San Francisco list prices are also down 4.9% annually, while inventory is up 96%.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why those two? </strong>NYC and San Francisco were the most expensive housing markets in the country before the pandemic. Life under lockdown may have given people the nudge they’d been considering for years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And where are they going? “Basically point a finger on a map, people are moving there...they’re going back to their roots,” one moving company exec <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/14/business/moving-company-covid.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the NYT</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Summer is typically the busiest time to move, but this year has been especially crazy for the residential real estate industry. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When it’s not penning reports, Zillow’s day job is to run an online real estate marketplace, and it’s going <em>really </em>well—on Thursday, Zillow recorded its <a href="https://blog.apptopia.com/zillow-app-breaks-personal-dau-record?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest</a> daily active user count ever, per Apptopia. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the Brew is proud to announce our Broadway Gauge, the best economic proxy this side of the Waffle House Index. It posits this—when Broadway returns, so will New York home values. Do you agree?</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F08%2F14%2Fzillow-report-finds-suburban-housing-markets-not-growing-expense-cities" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/14/us-retail-sales-continue-winning-streak?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
For Retail Sales, Follow the Stimulus
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Full shopping cart " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTAyL2Z1bGxfc2hvcHBpbmdfY2FydC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At least one part of this economic recovery is V-shaped. Retail spending <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/14/retail-sales-july-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">climbed</a> 1.2% in July, marking its third consecutive monthly increase and bringing the total value of U.S. retail sales above pre-pandemic levels.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Breaking it down: </strong>Though the jump is weaker than expected, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-14/rebound-in-u-s-retail-sales-slowed-in-july-amid-virus-s-surge?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nine of the 13</a> major spending categories did report higher sales last month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Breaking it down even more:</strong> </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Electronics and appliance stores led all retail categories with a 22.9% jump. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Spending at bars and restaurants increased just 5%. Many analysts think they'll take years to recover. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Auto industry sales were a damper, sliding 1.2%. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This rebound is encouraging but precarious. Economists say a huge reason retail sales grew for three straight months is that, despite historic unemployment, aggregate household income <em>increased</em> since March thanks to the federal stimulus under the CARES Act.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But those extra unemployment benefits stopped flowing on July 31, and the Senate is out of D.C. until after Labor Day after failing to agree on a new stimulus bill. Last week, President Trump signed an executive order authorizing up to $400 per week in additional benefits, but it's not clear when/if the extra cash will hit bank accounts.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/14/apps-including-facebook-rally-apple?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It’s Apple Vs. the Apps
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Demonic apple melting " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=471 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Kb5whPg4YqeVa/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Demonic apple melting " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Kb5whPg4YqeVa/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Thursday, <em>Fortnite</em> developer Epic Games went toe-to-toe with Apple and emerged with more than one <a href="https://twitter.com/FortniteGame/status/1294006412931223552?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pump-up video</a> to show for it. Other developers of apps that dot your phone's home screen have <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/in-battle-royale-against-apple-spotify-and-match-group-throw-support-behind-fortnite-developer-epic-2020-08-14?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joined the crusade</a> against Apple and its alleged monopolistic tactics.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who’s standing in solidarity </h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Facebook: </strong></span><span>After a limited rollout of a paid online events feature, head of the Facebook app Fidji Simo </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/14/facebook-says-apple-refused-to-waive-30percent-fee-on-new-feature.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">railed against</a></span><span> the “30% App Store tax.” In a blog post yesterday, he wrote that small and medium-sized businesses "will only be paid 70% of their hard-earned revenue” after Apple takes its cut. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Match Group: </strong></span><span>A spokesperson for the dating app giant said, “We fully support Epic Games’ efforts” and promised to fight “Apple’s arbitrary practices.” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Spotify</strong></span><span>: What’s a revolution without any music? A company spokesperson </span><span><a href="https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/tech/9434309/fortnite-apple-app-store-spotify-lawsuit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> “we applaud Epic Games’ decision to take a stand against Apple.” Spotify has been fighting its own war with Apple for years.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Despite the ideological posturing, keep in mind that all these companies would stand to financially benefit should Apple remove (or be forced to remove) its 30% fee for in-app purchases. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<img alt="Vincero" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTIzMC8xNTk2ODMwNjg1LW1iLWNyb3BfMTQwMHg4NDAuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lately, days have felt like weeks. Weeks like months. Could our freshman roommate be right? <em>Is time fake? </em>While your head spins, allow us to suggest how you can turn other people’s: <a href="https://vincerowatches.com/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=media&utm_medium=email&utm_content=August-20&utm_campaign=MorningBrew-AugA" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">with a Vincero watch</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Vincero watches are an <strong style="color:#000">affordable—yet bold—statement</strong>. They <strong style="color:#000">complement every vibe</strong>, and after you start wearing ’em on the daily, you’ll <strong style="color:#000">receive compliments on the daily</strong>, too.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, you’ll be so busy <a href="https://vincerowatches.com/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=media&utm_medium=email&utm_content=August-20&utm_campaign=MorningBrew-AugA" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">getting noticed</a> that you’ll stop noticing how slow time is moving. You know what they say: Time flies when you’re being complimented.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Speaking of time, Vincero’s been around for six years—that’s six spins<em> </em>around the sun, supposedly—and they’re celebrating with the <strong style="color:#000">biggest sale in company history</strong>. That means their already affordable timepieces just hit <a href="https://vincerowatches.com/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=media&utm_medium=email&utm_content=August-20&utm_campaign=MorningBrew-AugA" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new levels of affordability</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For a limited “time,” <a href="https://vincerowatches.com/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=media&utm_medium=email&utm_content=August-20&utm_campaign=MorningBrew-AugA" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">take up to 30% off Vincero’s store, plus free shipping</a>.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMBLING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/14/irs-memo-shows-plans-change-way-daily-fantasy-sports-betting-sites-taxed?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The IRS Kicks Sports Betting While It’s Down
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Roulette wheel" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MTcvc3BvcnRzX2dhbWJsaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the IRS decided that daily fantasy sports companies, like DraftKings and FanDuel, are required to pay a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-14/draftkings-fanduel-fees-deemed-taxable-in-landmark-irs-memo?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">federal excise tax</a> on the entry fees they collect from their users.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The IRS’s decision (while not binding in court) represents a “potentially business-destroying” development for these firms in some jurisdictions, gaming attorney Kate C. Lowenhar-Fisher told Bloomberg. DraftKings stock fell 6% on the day.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The company has non-tax issues, too</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">DraftKings yesterday posted a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/draftkings-posts-wider-loss-amid-limited-sports-activity-cites-pickup-in-betting-11597424407?mod=business_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">larger loss than expected</a> last quarter as the sports betting world was blindsided by the global sports shutdown. Toss in the recent college football <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/11/big-ten-pac12-postpone-2020-football-season?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cancellations</a>, and the industry is desperately looking for its Michael Oher. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It might have found one. As more professional leagues have resumed play, DraftKings said it observed an uptick in sports betting and ended last quarter with over $1.2 billion in cash—and no debt. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Goldman Sachs <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/penn-national-stock-price-barstool-sports-david-portnoy-goldman-upgrade-2020-8-1029502370?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slapping a “buy” rating</a> on Barstool Sports owner Penn National Gaming on Thursday shows that analysts expect a strong return to sweating 16-team parlays.</p>

!mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Simpsons clip showing moving houses\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/3orifebk0oO42ZWN20/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne of the enduring narratives of the pandemic is that Americans are ditching cities and embracing the suburbs. But a \u003ca href=\"https://www.zillow.com/research/2020-urb-suburb-market-report-27712/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew study\u003c/a\u003e from Zillow claims we might be driving up the wrong cul de sac. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe real estate company found that generally speaking, suburban housing markets have \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e strengthened relative to urban markets during the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Both region types appear to be hot sellers’ markets right now—while many suburban areas have seen strong improvement in housing activity in recent months, so, too, have many urban areas,” Zillow says. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile for-sale suburban homes attract more than 3x the traffic on Zillow right now than urban listings, that’s no different than last year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe outliers\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew York City and San Francisco. These hubs of innovation and $14 Bud Lights may actually be facing a significant housing downturn.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePer \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://streeteasy.com/blog/july-2020-market-reports/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eStreetEasy\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, Manhattan home values dropped 4.2% since last year and homes are staying on the market over two months longer.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSan Francisco list prices are also down 4.9% annually, while inventory is up 96%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy those two? \u003c/strong\u003eNYC and San Francisco were the most expensive housing markets in the country before the pandemic. Life under lockdown may have given people the nudge they’d been considering for years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd where are they going? “Basically point a finger on a map, people are moving there...they’re going back to their roots,” one moving company exec \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/14/business/moving-company-covid.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the NYT\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSummer is typically the busiest time to move, but this year has been especially crazy for the residential real estate industry. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen it’s not penning reports, Zillow’s day job is to run an online real estate marketplace, and it’s going \u003cem\u003ereally \u003c/em\u003ewell—on Thursday, Zillow recorded its \u003ca href=\"https://blog.apptopia.com/zillow-app-breaks-personal-dau-record?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehighest\u003c/a\u003e daily active user count ever, per Apptopia. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe Brew is proud to announce our Broadway Gauge, the best economic proxy this side of the Waffle House Index. It posits this—when Broadway returns, so will New York home values. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt least one part of this economic recovery is V-shaped. Retail spending \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/14/retail-sales-july-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclimbed\u003c/a\u003e 1.2% in July, marking its third consecutive monthly increase and bringing the total value of U.S. retail sales above pre-pandemic levels.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBreaking it down: \u003c/strong\u003eThough the jump is weaker than expected, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-14/rebound-in-u-s-retail-sales-slowed-in-july-amid-virus-s-surge?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enine of the 13\u003c/a\u003e major spending categories did report higher sales last month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBreaking it down even more:\u003c/strong\u003e \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eElectronics and appliance stores led all retail categories with a 22.9% jump. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpending at bars and restaurants increased just 5%. Many analysts think they'll take years to recover. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAuto industry sales were a damper, sliding 1.2%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis rebound is encouraging but precarious. Economists say a huge reason retail sales grew for three straight months is that, despite historic unemployment, aggregate household income \u003cem\u003eincreased\u003c/em\u003e since March thanks to the federal stimulus under the CARES Act.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut those extra unemployment benefits stopped flowing on July 31, and the Senate is out of D.C. until after Labor Day after failing to agree on a new stimulus bill. Last week, President Trump signed an executive order authorizing up to $400 per week in additional benefits, but it's not clear when/if the extra cash will hit bank accounts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Thursday, \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e developer Epic Games went toe-to-toe with Apple and emerged with more than one \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/FortniteGame/status/1294006412931223552?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/in-battle-royale-against-apple-spotify-and-match-group-throw-support-behind-fortnite-developer-epic-2020-08-14?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" standing in solidarity \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFacebook: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter a limited rollout of a paid online events feature, head of the Facebook app Fidji Simo \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/14/facebook-says-apple-refused-to-waive-30percent-fee-on-new-feature.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erailed against\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the “30% App Store tax.” In a blog post yesterday, he wrote style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMatch Group: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA spokesperson for the dating app giant said, “We fully support Epic Games’ efforts” and promised to fight “Apple’s arbitrary practices.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpotify\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: What’s a revolution without any music? A company spokesperson \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/tech/9434309/fortnite-apple-app-store-spotify-lawsuit?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Despite the ideological posturing, keep in mind that all these DraftKings stock fell 6% on the day.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe company has non-tax issues, too\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDraftKings yesterday posted a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/draftkings-posts-wider-loss-amid-limited-sports-activity-cites-pickup-in-betting-11597424407?mod=business_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elarger loss than expected\u003c/a\u003e last quarter as the sports betting world was blindsided by the global sports shutdown.
